intro: Senecio haygarthii, commonly known as the Haygarth's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
